title: Isn't this outrageous? (Internet blackout in jharkhand on 21st September and 22nd September)
selftext:
Hey everyone, this is something important we need to talk about

The Jharkhand government had decided to suspend mobile internet services across the entire state(and in my experience broadband services as well) on September 21st and 22nd from 8:00 AM to 1:30 PM each day. This shutdown was enforced to ensure a fair and transparent Jharkhand Staff Selection Commission, Combined Graduate Level JSSC(CGL) Examinations.

While ensuring exam integrity is crucial, is a state-wide internet shutdown the right solution? How do you all feel about such drastic measures for preventing exam malpractices?

References:

* [TOI](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/ranchi/internet-blackout-during-exam-period-hc-issues-notice-to-govt/articleshow/113560400.cms)
* [etvbharat](https://www.etvbharat.com/en/!state/jharkhand-internet-shutdown-and-high-court-intervention-enn24092104593)
* [thehindu](https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/jharkhand/suspension-of-mobile-internet-for-examination-arbitrary-decree-to-hide-jharkhand-government-failure-bjp/article68666807.ece)
